title: The extra second added to Teleport really hurt it
body: I understand the thinking behind why, but if any team has vision or is even close to seeing where the Teleport is coming from, the opposite team has 4.5 seconds to get away, and that is huge. 3.5 seconds before hand was balanced enough, now it makes it almost impossible to set up a gank with Teleport unless its executed almost perfectly and syncronously by all players. If you are going to make the timer to this extent, at least make it much harder to see, Teleport has a very long cooldown and it should be used for big plays once in a while.

That's not a problem... that's the POINT.

If your bot lane sets you up, the extra second won't break you.  Bait them into a push.  Chain CC.  Plant the ward someplace sneaky and make a bold flanking dive.  These all still work.

The POINT of the nerf was to stop top lane from being the lane where nothing happens except waiting for chances to tele gank.  Tele ganks can still work, but they're not the end-all be-all.   The constant threat of tele ganks bot was making top lane even MORE of a boring island due to the lack of kill pressure on both (likely tank) champs... AND making bot lane more boring by punishing teams that went even a little aggressive with the possibility of the instant-tele frag four man gankerino.
There's a punishment for ganking to a bot battle. You lose top turret and a kill isn't even guaranteed. So it's a risky decision.

> and someone that tp there shouldnt do that ganking job better than someone that took the time to actually walk and sneak there

I hate this logic. You act as If Teleport was automatic ability on group of chosen ones that have no trade-off. You realize that they pick it as Summoner Spell. They give up free true damage from Ignite; damage reduction, penetration and slow Exhaust gives; very good bonus MS and unit-pass from Ghost; decent shield from Barrier...

>  you have to ask "can i tp on an advantageous location to contribue? or better i just tp to my turret or dont use tp at all"

Well now they'll more likely be like "Okay, there's no ward in fog of war far enough not to be spotted but close enough so I can reach enemy so If I teleported in they'd run away anyway... Also my turret will probably fall soner than I finish my teleport which will only cancel it... Okay I'll just save it for splitpushing..." What makes you think that rather than stressing its various usages to increase decision making with it it will make it rather ineffective in various areas, leaving less opportunities where and when to use it and thus decreasing decision making?
It can't be that bad. I'm still seeing 2-4 with teleport every single game.

Yes. This change cemented teleport as an XP sustain/objective contesting summoner. It removed a lot of its early game power, which is a good thing. Without this change, there is zero reason to take TP over Ignite. Even if you can get a kill on the enemy top laner with Ignite, he can just TP gank bot and pick up a double. There's no counterplay for the enemy top laner except to also run TP, and that's what they've been doing. 

The only way to solve this issue was to make TP a bad ganking tool. This is good. There are plenty of champions who have powerful ganking tools in their kits that are made less relevant by the existence of Teleport, like Shen and Tahm Kench. Now, those champions and their impressive mobility have reason to be picked again, while TP is better used to set up dragon.

As someone who enjoyed taking TP on Kalista and bringing my oathsworn with me halfway across the map, I don't know how I'll ever get over the teleport changes.

I think teleport should be removed honestly. It's not fun to watch or to play with because it's like "oh I don't have to group cuz I can just teleport in". Without teleport, there would be much more strategy involved with controlling the minion wave up top and would open up many many more picks to be viable up top. Sure they can pick that maokai, but if I pick riven and dominate him i get map control due to being able to push it in and roam elsewhere. Fuck teleport. Out manuvering and out rotating your enemy is much more interesting to do and more interesting to watch.

The second thing they should change is the rift herald so that top is less like an island. Rift herald incentivises the one with the buff to split push top quite a lot, and if the person that gets the buff is already ahead (which is the most likely scenario) then top gets quite boring for the one whose down. top lane shouldn't be an island. Change the rift herald to a respawn and change the buff to something that helps the team in some way.
